elements.name: question1
elements.title: What does the rounding instruction to "round to the nearest 5 centimes in favor of the financial institution" mean? Mark the correct answer with a cross.
choices: It means that it is always bad for the customer: it is therefore always rounded down to the nearest five centimes.

It means that it is always bad for the customer: income (e.g. interest credited to the savings account) is rounded down to the nearest five centimes and expenses (e.g. account management fees) are rounded up to the nearest five centimes.
correctAnswer: It means that it is always bad for the customer: income (e.g. interest credited to the savings account) is rounded down to the nearest five centimes and expenses (e.g. account management fees) are rounded up to the nearest five centimes.
